posts.html:
Sensible Opinions is an independent publication launched in October 2023 by Ohsey. If you subscribe today, you'll get full access to the website as well as email newsletters about new content when it's available. Your subscription makes this site possible, and allows Sensible Opinions to continue to exist. Thank you!

Access all areas

By signing up, you'll get access to the full archive of everything that's been published before and everything that's still to come. Your very own private library.

Fresh content, delivered

Stay up to date with new content sent straight to your inbox! No more worrying about whether you missed something because of a pesky algorithm or news feed.

Meet people like you

Join a community of other subscribers who share the same interests.

Start your own thing

Enjoying the experience? Get started for free and set up your very own subscription business using Ghost, the same platform that powers this website.

If you subscribe today, you'll get full access to the website as well as email newsletters about new content when it's available. posts.title: What Is a Woman? No, seriously.

posts.html:
You've probably heard of it somewhere. Respect goes both ways. But where does it come from and does it have any

I am obviously gender non-conforming and, as a result, I am often wrongfully bundled among the others of whom are 'snowflakes' or, to better put it, shut down ideas different to their own. I would argue that every side does it, however, to entertain the notion of the far right, I will be sticking with this wording.

"Admiration felt or shown for someone or something that you believe has good ideas or qualities"

"Politeness, honour, and care shown towards someone or something that is considered important"

Listed above are two definitions of the word 'respect'; directly taken from the Cambridge Dictionary. Definition alone does not imply that respect has to be bidirectional. What do I mean by "respect goes both ways" then?

The phrase refers to every individual being equal, with equal potential for new ideas. Retaining this perspective means showing your opponent/colleague respect.

The key difference from the example provided above is that life isn't about competing with one another. It is about cooperation. Working together among friendly competition is what has led to our greatest achievements as a species. War and conflict have always been harmful for everyone involved. No one wins with war!

I believe that the phrase, while instinctively, seems true and helpful, is rather difficult to explain definitively what it stands for without using the phrase itself. I believe I have likely missed things from my analysis of the phrase. So, expect future revisions to this article.

The only thing I can definitively say is to question yourself every time you feel the need to repel against an idea. There's usually hidden bias within against the seemingly revolting idea.
posts.plaintext:
You've probably heard of it somewhere. Respect goes both ways. But where does it come from and does it have any

I am obviously gender non-conforming and, as a result, I am often wrongfully bundled among the others of whom are 'snowflakes' or, to better put it, shut down ideas different to their own. I would argue that every side does it, however, to entertain the notion of the far right, I will be sticking with this wording.

"Admiration felt or shown for someone or something that you believe has good ideas or qualities"

"Politeness, honour, and care shown towards someone or something that is considered important"

Listed above are two definitions of the word 'respect'; directly taken from the Cambridge Dictionary. Definition alone does not imply that respect has to be bidirectional. What do I mean by "respect goes both ways" then?

The phrase refers to every individual being equal, with equal potential for new ideas. Retaining this perspective means showing your opponent/colleague respect.

The key difference from the example provided above is that life isn't about competing with one another. It is about cooperation. Working together among friendly competition is what has led to our greatest achievements as a species. War and conflict have always been harmful for everyone involved. No one wins with war!

I believe that the phrase, while instinctively, seems true and helpful, is rather difficult to explain definitively what it stands for without using the phrase itself. I believe I have likely missed things from my analysis of the phrase. So, expect future revisions to this article.

The only thing I can definitively say is to question yourself every time you feel the need to repel against an idea. There's usually hidden bias within against the seemingly revolting idea.

posts.title: Don't waste your time 'fighting' people on social media.
posts.lexical: {"root":{"children":[{"children":[{"detail":0,"format":0,"mode":"normal","style":"","text":"It is incredibly unproductive for all parties. Be better, for yourself and everyone else!","type":"extended-text","version":1}],"direction":"ltr","format":"","indent":0,"type":"paragraph","version":1},{"children":[{"detail":0,"format":0,"mode":"normal","style":"","text":"Since the early 2010s, social media and the internet at large, has just become this disaster of finger pointing, accusing the other party of awful misconduct, and hypocrisy.","type":"extended-text","version":1}],"direction":"ltr","format":"","indent":0,"type":"paragraph","version":1}],"direction":"ltr","format":"","indent":0,"type":"root","version":1}}
posts.html:
It is incredibly unproductive for all parties. Be better, for yourself and everyone else!

Since the early 2010s, social media and the internet at large, has just become this disaster of finger pointing, accusing the other party of awful misconduct, and hypocrisy.
posts.plaintext:
It is incredibly unproductive for all parties. Be better, for yourself and everyone else!

Since the early 2010s, social media and the internet at large, has just become this disaster of finger pointing, accusing the other party of awful misconduct, and hypocrisy.

posts.title: The argument for god that no thiest talks about.
posts.lexical: {"root":{"children":[{"children":[{"detail":0,"format":0,"mode":"normal","style":"","text":"There is a really strong argument for the existence of god, that is based on science, that I have not seen discussed anywhere by anyone.","type":"extended-text","version":1}],"direction":"ltr","format":"","indent":0,"type":"paragraph","version":1}],"direction":"ltr","format":"","indent":0,"type":"root","version":1}}
